title: Have you ever eaten sweet potato pie? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, and the best I have ever had was … my own. See, food and I have an odd relationship. It likes me, I think, but I’m mostly neutral about it. The same can be said for any sort of physical exertion. It wasn’t always this way, but 20+ years of sitting at a desk in a world contained mostly in one’s head will do that. As a result, I view food as fuel only for the most part - a necessity. Cooking? Pfft. Something I did for others when I was a teen. Long story short, I inadvertently stumbled onto sweet potatoes in general (nutritious and easy to prepare), and the next Thanksgiving, I opted to bake a few pies. It took a few false starts, but I soon remembered what I’d learned decades before, so when I showed up at my then-GF’s place with the two pies I thought were best, I was ushered inside with a few sideways glances, but no real fuss. I forgot all about them in the rush of people to talk with and the mixed drinks to consume, so it was a bit of a shock to hear someone exclaim “Oh! This is the best sweet potato pie I have ever had.”. Turns out that it was my GF’s stepmother, and she was three sheets to the wind by then. Still, after that rousing approval, I grabbed a slice for myself, and it was also the best I have ever had. Well, it was the only sweet potato pie I’d ever had, but I did say those two were the best, didn’t I? So that makes two (3?) things I can cook well without fail: Eggs and toast, and sweet potato pie. You have to like everything very well done though, or you’re just the wrong demographic. :)

I was tricked into it. And I do mean tricked. Let me start off by saying that I hate eating sweet potatoes…the fries, cupcakes, all of it. However, I love pumpkin pie. My mom knows I love pumpkin pie. Every year, my parents invite a ton of family members over their house for Thanksgiving…and produce copious amounts of amazing food. Last year was no different. I text my mom asking her if she's made pumpkin pie. She says “Of course”. Great…wonderful…sweet…glorious pumpkin pie. I ate a slice, and yes…it was everything I dreamed of. My mom walks over to me and says, “You just ate sweet potato pie.” SORCERESS! What witchcraft have you been dabbling in?!? I felt like my own mother had betrayed me. The one thing I hated most at the Thanksgiving dinner table actually tasted delicious to me?!? Thanksgiving has changed forever now. I don't even know who I am anymore.
